db:abstract.db:para: The QQmlProperty class abstracts accessing properties on objects created from QML.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: As QML uses Qt's meta-type system all of the existing QMetaObject classes can be used to introspect and interact with objects created by QML. However, some of the new features provided by QML - such as type safety and attached properties - are most easily used through the QQmlProperty class that simplifies some of their natural complexity.

Unlike QMetaProperty which represents a property on a class type, QQmlProperty encapsulates a property on a specific object instance. To read a property's value, programmers create a QQmlProperty instance and call the read() method. Likewise to write a property value the write() method is used.

db:section.db:title: enum QQmlProperty::PropertyTypeCategory
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies a category of QML property.

db:td.db:para: The property is invalid, or is a signal property.
The property is a QQmlListProperty list property

db:section.db:title: enum QQmlProperty::Type
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies a type of QML property.

db:td.db:para: The property is a regular Qt property.
The property is a signal property.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty()
db:section.db:para: Create an invalid QQmlProperty.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the default property of obj. If there is no default property, an invalid QQmlProperty will be created.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj, QQmlContext *ctxt)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the default property of obj using the context ctxt. If there is no default property, an invalid QQmlProperty will be created.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj, QQmlEngine *engine)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the default property of obj using the environment for instantiating QML components that is provided by engine. If there is no default property, an invalid QQmlProperty will be created.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj, const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the property name of obj.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj, const QString &name, QQmlContext *ctxt)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the property name of obj using the context ctxt.
Creating a QQmlProperty without a context will render some properties - like attached properties - inaccessible.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(QObject *obj, const QString &name, QQmlEngine *engine)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QQmlProperty for the property name of obj using the environment for instantiating QML components that is provided by engine.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::QQmlProperty(const QQmlProperty &other)
db:section.db:para: Create a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::connectNotifySignal(QObject *dest, const char *slot) const
db:section.db:para: Connects the property's change notifier signal to the specified slot of the dest object and returns true. Returns false if this metaproperty does not represent a regular Qt property or if it has no change notifier signal, or if the dest object does not have the specified slot.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::connectNotifySignal(QObject *dest, int method) const
db:section.db:para: Connects the property's change notifier signal to the specified method of the dest object and returns true. Returns false if this metaproperty does not represent a regular Qt property or if it has no change notifier signal, or if the dest object does not have the specified method.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::hasNotifySignal() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the property has a change notifier signal, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: int QQmlProperty::index() const
db:section.db:para: Return the Qt metaobject index of the property.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isDesignable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the property is designable, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isProperty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QQmlProperty represents a regular Qt property.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isResettable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the property is resettable, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isSignalProperty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QQmlProperty represents a QML signal property.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the QQmlProperty refers to a valid property, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::isWritable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the property is writable, otherwise false.

db:section.db:title: QMetaMethod QQmlProperty::method() const
db:section.db:para: Return the QMetaMethod for this property if it is a SignalProperty, otherwise returns an invalid QMetaMethod.

db:section.db:title: QString QQmlProperty::name() const
db:section.db:para: Return the name of this QML property.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::needsNotifySignal() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the property needs a change notifier signal for bindings to remain upto date, false otherwise.
Some properties, such as attached properties or those whose value never changes, do not require a change notifier.

db:section.db:title: QObject *QQmlProperty::object() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QQmlProperty's QObject.

db:section.db:title: QMetaProperty QQmlProperty::property() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the Qt property associated with this QML property.

db:section.db:title: int QQmlProperty::propertyType() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVariant type of the property, or QVariant::Invalid if the property has no QVariant type.

db:section.db:title: QQmlProperty::PropertyTypeCategory QQmlProperty::propertyTypeCategory() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the property category.

db:section.db:title: const char *QQmlProperty::propertyTypeName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type name of the property, or 0 if the property has no type name.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QQmlProperty::read() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the property value.

db:section.db:title: bool QQmlProperty::reset() const
db:section.db:para: Resets the property and returns true if the property is resettable. If the property is not resettable, nothing happens and false is returned.
